content: Assuming that edit/mute icons alongside topic names are not used very often, what we can do is make them appear only when hovered over them.Please refer to the attached images for better reference. Present-scenario.png Proposed-changes.png
If anything, I would like them to be more visible and discoverable.
Well, if we made them appear at a higher visibility only when the recipient block as a whole is hovered, that might achieve that goal.
I agree limiting it to hover on just the recipient bar would be a mistake.

Any time something is fully invisible except on hover (and, more idealistically, any time the appearance changes at all on hover), we should probably consider the mobile web, where there is no hover gesture. See the "Second Bug" described at #13642 for an example in the wild: you can star a message by interacting with an empty space, which I'd call a bug.
I am not entirely against hover effects, but they almost always have multiple accessibility concerns.

Making them appear when hovering the recipient block as a whole appears to be a nice idea.
Also, I went through the issue #13642. Seems like the latest commit made was to make the icons permanently displayed when the screen width reaches a certain threshold (mobile view).
I noticed that we are using the same icon for preview message in compose message and for the mute topic icon, I guess for Mute using disabled bell will be a better option
@Siddharth hmm, good thought, submit a PR and we can see how it looks. We'll want to change it in all of the places we have an icon for muting.
@Siddharth this change was merged; hopefully folks will like how it looks when it's deployed here in the next day or so.
